title: Akshara Brahma Yoga
subtitle: The Yoga of the Imperishable Absolute
summary: This chapter reveals profound knowledge about the nature of the Supreme, the process of leaving the body at death, and the paths of light and darkness. Krishna explains the practice of remembering God at the time of death, the concept of the eternal cycle of creation, and the supreme destination of never returning to material existence.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच | किं तद्ब्रह्म किमध्यात्मं किं कर्म पुरुषोत्तम | अधिभूतं च किं प्रोक्तमधिदैवं किमुच्यते ||
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca | kiṃ tad brahma kim adhyātmaṃ kiṃ karma puruṣottama | adhibhūtaṃ ca kiṃ proktam adhidaivaṃ kim ucyate ||
verses.translation: Arjuna said: O Supreme Person, what is Brahman? What is the self? What is action? What is called the adhibhuta (the material manifestation)? And what is adhidaiva (the divine manifestation)?
verses.explanation: Arjuna asks for clarification on five fundamental spiritual concepts to deepen his understanding of reality.

verses.sanskrit: अधियज्ञः कथं कोऽत्र देहेऽस्मिन्मधुसूदन | प्रयाणकाले च कथं ज्ञेयोऽसि नियतात्मभिः ||
verses.transliteration: adhiyajñaḥ kathaṃ ko 'tra dehe 'smin madhusūdana | prayāṇa-kāle ca kathaṃ jñeyo 'si niyatātmabhiḥ ||
verses.translation: Who is the adhiyajña (the Lord of sacrifice) and how does He dwell in this body, O Madhusudana? And how at the time of death are You to be known by the self-controlled?
verses.explanation: Arjuna inquires about the indwelling Lord and the process of remembering God at the critical moment of death.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | अक्षरं ब्रह्म परमं स्वभावोऽध्यात्ममुच्यते | भूतभावोद्भवकरो विसर्गः कर्मसंज्ञितः ||
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca | akṣaraṃ brahma paramaṃ svabhāvo 'dhyātmam ucyate | bhūta-bhāvodbhava-karo visargaḥ karma-saṃjñitaḥ ||
verses.translation: The Blessed Lord said: The indestructible, transcendental Supreme is called Brahman. The individual self is called adhyatma. The offering that causes the development of material beings is called karma.
verses.explanation: Krishna begins answering by defining Brahman (the Absolute), adhyatma (the soul), and karma (creative actions).

verses.sanskrit: अधिभूतं क्षरो भावः पुरुषश्चाधिदैवतम् | अधियज्ञोऽहमेवात्र देहे देहभृतां वर ||
verses.transliteration: adhibhūtaṃ kṣaro bhāvaḥ puruṣaś cādhidaivatam | adhiyajño 'ham evātra dehe deha-bhṛtāṃ vara ||
verses.translation: The perishable nature is called adhibhuta. The cosmic spirit is called adhidaiva. O best of the embodied, I Myself am the adhiyajña (the Lord of sacrifice) in the body.
verses.explanation: Krishna completes the definitions: adhibhuta (material elements), adhidaiva (universal form), and reveals Himself as adhiyajña (the enjoyer of all sacrifices).

verses.sanskrit: अन्तकाले च मामेव स्मरन्मुक्त्वा कलेवरम् | यः प्रयाति स मद्भावं याति नास्त्यत्र संशयः ||
verses.transliteration: anta-kāle ca mām eva smaran muktvā kalevaram | yaḥ prayāti sa mad-bhāvaṃ yāti nāsty atra saṃśayaḥ ||
verses.translation: Whoever, at the time of death, remembering Me alone, leaves the body and departs—he attains My nature; of this there is no doubt.
verses.explanation: Krishna reveals the supreme secret: remembering Him at death ensures attainment of the Divine.

verses.sanskrit: यं यं वापि स्मरन्भावं त्यजत्यन्ते कलेवरम् | तं तमेवैति कौन्तेय सदा तद्भावभावितः ||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ yaṃ vāpi smaran bhāvaṃ tyajaty ante kalevaram | taṃ tam evaiti kaunteya sadā tad-bhāva-bhāvitaḥ ||
verses.translation: Whatever state of being one remembers at the time of death, O Kaunteya, that state he attains, being ever absorbed in its thought.
verses.explanation: The law of final consciousness: one attains what one predominantly thinks about throughout life and at death.

verses.sanskrit: तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु मामनुस्मर युध्य च | मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्मामेवैष्यस्यसंशयः ||
verses.transliteration: tasmāt sarveṣu kāleṣu mām anusmara yudhya ca | mayy arpita-mano-buddhir mām evaiṣyasy asaṃśayaḥ ||
verses.translation: Therefore, at all times remember Me and fight. With mind and intellect surrendered to Me, you will surely come to Me.
verses.explanation: Krishna advises constant remembrance while performing duties, assuring this leads to Him.

verses.sanskrit: अभ्यासयोगयुक्तेन चेतसा नान्यगामिना | परमं पुरुषं दिव्यं याति पार्थानुचिन्तयन् ||
verses.transliteration: abhyāsa-yoga-yuktena cetasā nānya-gāminā | paramaṃ puruṣaṃ divyaṃ yāti pārthānucintayan ||
verses.translation: With the mind not wandering to anything else, disciplined by the practice of yoga, constantly meditating on the Supreme Divine Person, one attains Him, O Partha.
verses.explanation: The method: single-pointed meditation through yoga practice leads to the Divine.

verses.sanskrit: कविं पुराणमनुशासितारमणोरणीयांसमनुस्मरेद्यः | सर्वस्य धातारमचिन्त्यरूपमादित्यवर्णं तमसः परस्तात् ||
verses.transliteration: kaviṃ purāṇam anuśāsitāram aṇor aṇīyāṃsam anusmared yaḥ | sarvasya dhātāram acintya-rūpam āditya-varṇaṃ tamasaḥ parastāt ||
verses.translation: One should meditate on the Omniscient, Ancient, Ruler, subtler than the atom, Supporter of all, Inconceivable, Effulgent like the sun, Beyond material darkness.
verses.explanation: Krishna describes how to meditate on God's transcendental attributes.

verses.sanskrit: प्रयाणकाले मनसाऽचलेन भक्त्या युक्तो योगबलेन चैव | भ्रुवोर्मध्ये प्राणमावेश्य सम्यक् स तं परं पुरुषमुपैति दिव्यम् ||
verses.transliteration: prayāṇa-kāle manasā 'calena bhaktyā yukto yoga-balena caiva | bhruvor madhye prāṇam āveśya samyak sa taṃ paraṃ puruṣam upaiti divyam ||
verses.translation: At the time of death, with unwavering mind, fortified with devotion and yogic power, fixing the life-force between the eyebrows, one attains that Supreme Divine Person.
verses.explanation: The yogic process for death: focus between eyebrows with devotion leads to the Divine.

verses.sanskrit: यदक्षरं वेदविदो वदन्ति विशन्ति यद्यतयो वीतरागाः | यदिच्छन्तो ब्रह्मचर्यं चरन्ति तत्ते पदं संग्रहेण प्रवक्ष्ये ||
verses.transliteration: yad akṣaraṃ vedavido vadanti viśanti yad yatayo vīta-rāgāḥ | yad icchanto brahmacaryaṃ caranti tat te padaṃ saṃgraheṇa pravakṣye ||
verses.translation: That which the knowers of the Vedas call the Imperishable, which the ascetics free from passion enter, and desiring which they practice celibacy—that goal I shall briefly explain to you.
verses.explanation: Krishna promises to summarize the supreme destination sought by Vedic scholars and ascetics.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वद्वाराणि संयम्य मनो हृदि निरुध्य च | मूर्ध्न्याधायात्मनः प्राणमास्थितो योगधारणाम् ||
verses.transliteration: sarva-dvārāṇi saṃyamya mano hṛdi nirudhya ca | mūrdhny ādhāyātmanaḥ prāṇam āsthito yoga-dhāraṇām ||
verses.translation: Closing all the gates (of the senses), confining the mind within the heart, fixing the life-force in the head, established in yogic concentration,
verses.explanation: The yogic technique: withdraw senses, focus mind inward, and elevate consciousness.

verses.sanskrit: ओमित्येकाक्षरं ब्रह्म व्याहरन्मामनुस्मरन् | यः प्रयाति त्यजन्देहं स याति परमां गतिम् ||
verses.transliteration: om ity ekākṣaraṃ brahma vyāharan mām anusmaran | yaḥ prayāti tyajan dehaṃ sa yāti paramāṃ gatim ||
verses.translation: Chanting the single-syllable Om—Brahman—remembering Me, he who departs leaving the body, attains the supreme goal.
verses.explanation: The power of Om and divine remembrance at death for attaining liberation.

verses.sanskrit: अनन्यचेताः सततं यो मां स्मरति नित्यशः | तस्याहं सुलभः पार्थ नित्ययुक्तस्य योगिनः ||
verses.transliteration: ananya-cetāḥ satataṃ yo māṃ smarati nityaśaḥ | tasyāhaṃ sulabhaḥ pārtha nitya-yuktasya yoginaḥ ||
verses.translation: To that yogi of constant remembrance, worshiping with undeviating mind, O Partha, I am easily attainable.
verses.explanation: Constant, single-minded devotion makes Krishna readily accessible.

verses.sanskrit: मामुपेत्य पुनर्जन्म दुःखालयमशाश्वतम् | नाप्नुवन्ति महात्मानः संसिद्धिं परमां गताः ||
verses.transliteration: mām upetya punar janma duḥkhālayam aśāśvatam | nāpnuvanti mahātmānaḥ saṃsiddhiṃ paramāṃ gatāḥ ||
verses.translation: Having attained Me, the great souls are not reborn in this miserable, impermanent world, for they have reached the highest perfection.
verses.explanation: Those who attain Krishna escape the cycle of rebirth in the material world.

verses.sanskrit: आब्रह्मभुवनाल्लोकाः पुनरावर्तिनोऽर्जुन | मामुपेत्य तु कौन्तेय पुनर्जन्म न विद्यते ||
verses.transliteration: ā-brahma-bhuvanāl lokāḥ punar āvartino 'rjuna | mām upetya tu kaunteya punar janma na vidyate ||
verses.translation: From the highest planet in the material world down to the lowest, all are places of misery wherein repeated birth and death occur. But one who attains My abode, O Kaunteya, never takes birth again.
verses.explanation: All material realms involve suffering and rebirth; Krishna's realm offers eternal liberation.

verses.sanskrit: सहस्रयुगपर्यन्तमहर्यद्ब्रह्मणो विदुः | रात्रिं युगसहस्रान्तां तेऽहोरात्रविदो जनाः ||
verses.transliteration: sahasra-yuga-paryantam ahar yad brahmaṇo viduḥ | rātriṃ yuga-sahasrāntāṃ te 'ho-rātra-vido janāḥ ||
verses.translation: By human calculation, a thousand ages taken together form the duration of Brahma's one day. And such also is the duration of his night.
verses.explanation: Krishna reveals the vast cosmic time scale governing universal cycles.

verses.sanskrit: अव्यक्ताद्व्यक्तयः सर्वाः प्रभवन्त्यहरागमे | रात्र्यागमे प्रलीयन्ते तत्रैवाव्यक्तसंज्ञके ||
verses.transliteration: avyaktād vyaktayaḥ sarvāḥ prabhavanty ahar-āgame | rātry-āgame pralīyante tatraivāvyakta-saṃjñake ||
verses.translation: At the beginning of Brahma's day, all manifested beings emerge from the unmanifest state, and at the fall of night they merge into that same unmanifest.
verses.explanation: The periodic creation and dissolution of all cosmic manifestations.

verses.sanskrit: भूतग्रामः स एवायं भूत्वा भूत्वा प्रलीयते | रात्र्यागमेऽवशः पार्थ प्रभवत्यहरागमे ||
verses.transliteration: bhūta-grāmaḥ sa evāyaṃ bhūtvā bhūtvā pralīyate | rātry-āgame 'vaśaḥ pārtha prabhavaty ahar-āgame ||
verses.translation: The same multitude of beings, having come into existence again and again, merge at the approach of night, O Partha, and emerge at the coming of day, helpless.
verses.explanation: All beings are subject to these cosmic cycles repeatedly, without free will.

verses.sanskrit: परस्तस्मात्तु भावोऽन्योऽव्यक्तोऽव्यक्तात्सनातनः | यः स सर्वेषु भूतेषु नश्यत्सु न विनश्यति ||
verses.transliteration: paras tasmāt tu bhāvo 'nyo 'vyakto 'vyaktāt sanātanaḥ | yaḥ sa sarveṣu bhūteṣu naśyatsu na vinaśyati ||
verses.translation: But beyond this unmanifested nature is another eternal, unmanifested existence—that Supreme which does not perish when all beings perish.
verses.explanation: Beyond temporary cosmic manifestations exists the eternal spiritual reality.

verses.sanskrit: अव्यक्तोऽक्षर इत्युक्तस्तमाहुः परमां गतिम् | यं प्राप्य न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम ||
verses.transliteration: avyakto 'kṣara ity uktas tam āhuḥ paramāṃ gatim | yaṃ prāpya na nivartante tad dhāma paramaṃ mama ||
verses.translation: That which is called the unmanifest and imperishable, that is said to be the supreme destination. Attaining which, none return. That is My supreme abode.
verses.explanation: Krishna's eternal realm is the ultimate destination from which there's no return to material existence.

verses.sanskrit: पुरुषः स परः पार्थ भक्त्या लभ्यस्त्वनन्यया | यस्यान्तःस्थानि भूतानि येन सर्वमिदं ततम् ||
verses.transliteration: puruṣaḥ sa paraḥ pārtha bhaktyā labhyas tv ananyayā | yasyāntaḥsthāni bhūtāni yena sarvam idaṃ tatam ||
verses.translation: The Supreme Person, O Partha, is attained by unalloyed devotion. Though He dwells in all beings, yet He is the source and support of all.
verses.explanation: Exclusive devotion is the means to attain the all-pervading Supreme Being.

verses.sanskrit: यत्र काले त्वनावृत्तिमावृत्तिं चैव योगिनः | प्रयाता यान्ति तं कालं वक्ष्यामि भरतर्षभ ||
verses.transliteration: yatra kāle tv anāvṛttim āvṛttiṃ caiva yoginaḥ | prayātā yānti taṃ kālaṃ vakṣyāmi bharatarṣabha ||
verses.translation: O best of the Bharatas, I shall now explain to you the different times at which, departing, the yogis do or do not return.
verses.explanation: Krishna prepares to explain the two paths after death - of return and no return.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर्ज्योतिरहः शुक्लः षण्मासा उत्तरायणम् | तत्र प्रयाता गच्छन्ति ब्रह्म ब्रह्मविदो जनाः ||
verses.transliteration: agnir jyotir ahaḥ śuklaḥ ṣaṇ māsā uttarāyaṇam | tatra prayātā gacchanti brahma brahma-vido janāḥ ||
verses.translation: Fire, light, daytime, the bright fortnight, the six months of the northern solstice—departing by this path, knowers of Brahman attain Brahman.
verses.explanation: The path of light (northern path) leads to liberation for the spiritually enlightened.

verses.sanskrit: धूमो रात्रिस्तथा कृष्णः षण्मासा दक्षिणायनम् | तत्र चान्द्रमसं ज्योतिर्योगी प्राप्य निवर्तते ||
verses.transliteration: dhūmo rātris tathā kṛṣṇaḥ ṣaṇ māsā dakṣiṇāyanam | tatra cāndramasaṃ jyotir yogī prāpya nivartate ||
verses.translation: Smoke, night, the dark fortnight, the six months of the southern solstice—the yogi departing by this path attains the lunar light but returns.
verses.explanation: The path of darkness (southern path) leads to temporary celestial realms and rebirth.

verses.sanskrit: शुक्लकृष्णे गती ह्येते जगतः शाश्वते मते | एकया यात्यनावृत्तिमन्ययावर्तते पुनः ||
verses.transliteration: śukla-kṛṣṇe gatī hy ete jagataḥ śāśvate mate | ekayā yāty anāvṛttim anyayāvartate punaḥ ||
verses.translation: These two paths—the bright and the dark—are considered eternal for this world. By one, one attains liberation; by the other, one returns again.
verses.explanation: The two eternal paths governing all beings' post-death destinations.

verses.sanskrit: नैते सृती पार्थ जानन्योगी मुह्यति कश्चन | तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु योगयुक्तो भवार्जुन ||
verses.transliteration: naite sṛtī pārtha jānan yogī muhyati kaścana | tasmāt sarveṣu kāleṣu yoga-yukto bhavārjuna ||
verses.translation: No yogi who knows these two paths is ever deluded, O Partha. Therefore, at all times be steadfast in yoga.
verses.explanation: Knowledge of these paths prevents confusion; Krishna urges constant yoga practice.

verses.sanskrit: वेदेषु यज्ञेषु तपःसु चैव दानेषु यत्पुण्यफलं प्रदिष्टम् | अत्येति तत्सर्वमिदं विदित्वा योगी परं स्थानमुपैति चाद्यम् ||
verses.transliteration: vedeṣu yajñeṣu tapaḥsu caiva dāneṣu yat puṇya-phalaṃ pradiṣṭam | atyeti tat sarvam idaṃ viditvā yogī paraṃ sthānam upaiti cādyam ||
verses.translation: The yogi who knows this transcends all the rewards offered by the study of the Vedas, sacrifices, austerities, and charities, and attains the supreme, primordial abode.
verses.explanation: The yogi who understands these truths surpasses all ritualistic merits and reaches the eternal spiritual realm.
